text: A small update on the live coding tool.  This shows an experiment I tried with generation of a musical pattern, in a similar way to Extempore.

elements.text: A small update on the live coding tool.  This shows an experiment I tried with generation of a musical pattern, in a similar way to Extempore.

text: what's the design behind stopping something that is playing?

elements.text: what's the design behind stopping something that is playing?

text: in many places you keep a reference to the thing and ask it to stop or have a general function that stops everything, how does it work here?

elements.text: in many places you keep a reference to the thing and ask it to stop or have a general function that stops everything, how does it work here?

text:
Yeah, both.  I don't have it yet, but I was planning to add a way to stop all notes, and possibly individual synthesizers.  In terms of pattern, what I've seen is that each pattern has a name, and can be individually stopped/started.  I don't show it in the vid, but you can make different named patterns and play different synths at the same time.
In extempore you disable a pattern by using a different operator, I copied that by adding a ! after the pat command.
In the video I stop/start stuff because I haven't yet added the code to have the pattern wait for the next cycle before updating itself.  I _think_ I'll need to keep the last pattern around until beat 0 comes around and swap in the updated copy.
I will refresh my memory on Tidal Cycles, and have a look at FoxDot/Ixi lang to see what they do too.
